Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to balance work and personal life, citing challenges with working late that encroach on personal time.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been practicing saying no, which has felt empowering. They have faced some guilt but are working on reframing their thoughts. They also tried loving-kindness meditation, which made them feel more connected and soothed.
Risk Assessment: The patient feels guilty about setting boundaries and is concerned about falling behind at work.
Progress Evaluation: The patient feels more empowered with each session and is making strides in self-care practices.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to continue using reframing strategies and loving-kindness meditation.
Next Steps: The patient plans to establish a work cut-off time of 6 PM and will discuss progress in the next session.
